isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - ANTILOCK BRAKE INTERFACE

svcproc.title: ANTILOCK BRAKE INTERFACE
svcproc.para: On vehicles with both the Bendix Antilock Brake System (ABS) and the Allison WTEC III transmission, circuit 94J and a torque converter lock-up drop relay (570) link the ABS ECU with the WTEC III ECU.

The torque converter lock-up drop relay (570) has 12 volt power fed to its coil from fuse (301), and circuits 13K, 13L, and 94F. The relay also has a ground path applied to its normally open contact by way of circuit 161A, connector (418), and circuits 161A and 161 going to the Allison ECU "V" connector (632) signal ground pin 31.

Under normal vehicle operation the ABS controller (288) does not have its pin K1 switched to ground and the WTEC III ECU is permitted to allow the transmission retarder to function and torque converter to lock-up.

If the ABS controller (288) senses an impending wheel lock-up condition, it will modulate the air brakes (to prevent wheel lock-up), and it will switch its pin K1 low (to ground). This allows power to flow through the coil of the torque converter drop relay (570), circuit 94J, connector (13), and a yellow wire to pin K1. This energizes relay (570) and applies a ground path to the Allison ECU "V" connector (632)/pin 27 by way of circuit 154A, connector (418), and circuit 154E to pin 30 of relay (570). This will cause the WTEC III ECU to disengage the torque converter lock-up clutch and the engine brake if so equipped.
